data.event: The town of Bloomington was settled in June 1854 but was not called as such until April 1855 when Harrison Burson applied to the U.S. Government for a post office.

event.title: was not called as such until April 1855

data.event: The town of Bloomington was settled in June 1854 but was not called as such until April 1855 when Harrison Burson applied to the U.S. Government for a post office.

event.title: early 1857, the north half of Bloomington was moved

data.event: In early 1857, the north half of Bloomington was moved to a new location and the south portion of the town was renamed Winchester.

event.title: Later in the year Bloomington acted

data.event: Later in the year Bloomington acted to become an incorporated city with Winchester following suit four days later.
Winchester was incorporated on February 20, 1857 under the name of Clinton.

event.title: August 30, the post office was moved

data.event: Bloomington started losing ground in 1858 when on August 30, the post office was moved to Clinton.

event.title: the first five years of existence, Clinton constructed

data.event: Within the first five years of existence, Clinton constructed two schoolhouses, two churches and a town hall.
In 1869, the Clinton Cemetery was established on land already used for a cemetery and is considered one of the oldest burial grounds in Douglas County.
